page.title: 2009â10 Kent State Golden Flashes men's basketball team

revisions.rev:
{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |Year=2009â10 |Prev year=2008â09 |Next year=2010â11 |Team=Kent State Golden Flashes |Image=Kent State Centennial athletic.png |Conference=Mid-American Conference |Division=
East Division |ShortConference=MAC |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=24â10 |ConfRecord=13â3 |HeadCoach=[[Geno Ford]] |AsstCoach1=Rob Senderoff |AsstCoach2=Bobby Steinburg |AsstCoach3=Armon Gates |StadiumArena=[[Memorial Athletic and Convocation Center]] |Champion= MAC East Division Champions
MAC Regular Season Champions |BowlTourney=[[2010 National Invitation Tournament|NIT]] |BowlTourneyResult=Second Round }} {{2009â10 Mid-American Conference men's basketball standings}} The '''2009â10 Kent State [[Kent State Golden Flashes|Golden Flashes]] [[Kent State Golden Flashes men's basketball|men's basketball team]]''' represented [[Kent State University]] in the [[2009â10 NCAA Division I men's basketball season|2009â10]] college basketball season. The team was coached by [[Geno Ford]] and played their home games in the [[Memorial Athletic and Convocation Center]]. They are members of the [[Mid-American Conference]]. They finished the season 24–10, 13–3 in MAC play to win the east division and overall regular season championship. As the 1 seed they were upset by 9 seed and eventual champion [[2009â10 Ohio Bobcats men's basketball team|Ohio]] in the quarterfinals of the [[2010 MAC Men's Basketball Tournament]]. As regular season champions they received an automatic bid to the [[2010 National Invitation Tournament]] where they advanced to the second round before falling to [[2009â10 Illinois Fighting Illini men's basketball team|Illinois]]. ==Before the season== ===Roster changes=== The Golden Flashes lost four seniors from their 2008â09 roster. These seniors include the starters [[Al Fisher]], [[Jordan Mincy]], and [[Julian Sullinger]]. Fisher was the team's leading scorer, averaging 14.4 points per game. The team also lost [[Rashad Woods]], who was suspended last year due to a violation of team rules.{{cite news |title=Coles soon to become Miami's win leader |first=Elton |last=Alexander |newspaper=Cleveland Plain Dealer |date=2009-04-13 |url=http://www.cleveland.com/collegesports/plaindealer/index.ssf?/base/sports/1231839015183500.xml&coll=2}} To compensate for the team's losses, four new players joined the Flashes for the 2009â10 basketball season. Only one of these four players is a freshman, while one sophomore and two juniors are recruits from junior colleges. ===Recruiting=== {{College Athlete Recruit Start}} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Greg Avila | position = PF | hometown = Bronx, NY | highschool = Harcum College | feet = 6 | inches = 6 | weight = 235 | commitdate = 2008-09-08 | scout stars = 2 | rivals stars = 0 | espn grade = | grayshirt = }} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Randal Holt | position = PG | hometown = Bedford, OH | highschool = Glenville HS | feet = 6 | inches = 1 | weight = 180 | commitdate = 2008-09-13 | scout stars = 2 | rivals stars = 0 | espn grade = 85 | grayshirt = }} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Justin Manns | position = C | hometown = Winston-Salem, NC | highschool = Owens CC | feet = 6 | inches = 11 | weight = 215 | commitdate = 2009-04-15 | scout stars = | rivals stars = 0 | espn grade = | grayshirt = }} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Ian Pinckney | position = SG | hometown = Chicago, IL | highschool = Motlow CC | feet = 6 | inches = 3 | weight = 195 | commitdate = 2009-05-07 | scout stars = | rivals stars = 0 | espn grade = | grayshirt = }} {{College Athlete Recruit End | year = 2009 | rivals ref title = Kent State Commit List for 2009 | scout ref title = Scout.com: Men's Basketball Recruiting | espn ref title = | rivals school = 144 | scout s = 75 | espn schoolid = | scout overall = | rivals overall = | accessdate = 2009-10-17 | bball = yes }} == Roster == Roster current as of June 25, when their summer prospectus was published.{{cite press release |url=https://www.nmnathletics.com//pdf5/421456.pdf?ATCLID=3756190&SPID=4464&DB_OEM_ID=11400&SPSID=47654 |publisher=Kent State University |date=2009-06-25 |title=2009-10 Kent State Men's Basketball: Quick Facts |accessdate=2009-10-17}} {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; All times are in [[Eastern Time Zone]]. |} == Statistics == {|class="wikitable sortable" |- align="center" style="background: #{{CollegePrimaryHex|Kent State Golden Flashes}};color: #{{CollegeSecondaryHex|Kent State Golden Flashes}}" | '''Player''' || '''GP''' || '''Min''' || '''FG''' || '''3P''' || '''FT'''|| '''Reb'''|| '''Ast'''|| '''Blk'''|| '''Stl'''|| '''Pts''' |- align="center" bgcolor="" | || || || || || || || || || || |- align="center" bgcolor="" |} ''Legend: GP = Games Played; Min = Minutes Played; FG = [[Field goal (basketball)|Field Goals]]; 3P = [[Three-point field goal|Three Pointers]]; FT = [[Free throw|Free Throws]]; Reb = [[Rebound (basketball)|Rebounds]]; Ast = [[Assist (basketball)|Assists]]; Blk = [[Block (basketball)|Blocks]]; Stl = [[Steal (basketball)|Steals]]; Pts = [[Point (basketball)|Points]]'' == After the season == === Comments === === Awards === On March 8, 2010, head coach [[Geno Ford]] was named the Mid-American Conference Coach of the Year, the seventh time a KSU coach has won the award (Jim McDonald, 1990; [[Gary Waters]], 1999 and 2000; [[Stan Heath]], 2002; and [[Jim Christian]], 2006 and 2008). He was selected by three votes over [[Keith Dambrot]] of Akron.{{cite web |url=http://mac-sports.com/ViewArticle.dbml?DB_OEM_ID=9400&ATCLID=204903780 |title=MAC Announces Player of the Year, Coach of the Year |work=MAC-Sports.com |publisher=[[Mid-American Conference]] |date=March 8, 2010 |accessdate=March 4, 2011}} ==Notes== {{Reflist}} {{Kent State University}} {{2009â10 Mid-American men's basketball}} {{DEFAULTSORT:2009â10 Kent State Golden Flashes Men's Basketball Team}} [[Category:Kent State Golden Flashes men's basketball seasons]] [[Category:2009â10 Mid-American Conference men's basketball season|Kent State Golden Flashes]] [[Category:2010 National Invitation Tournament participants|Kent State]]
